Comments_List: Essential class to get a grasp on East European political history and contemporary political thinking.
You learn a lot about Eastern Europe.

Gained a much deeper historic and philosophic understanding of the region, and how the regional ideas impacted the wider European and international structures. Seminars were very engaging, discussions with Professor Snyder are amazing and an absolute privilege. Don't be scared off by the on-the-spot presentations - it is scary at first, but an amazing experience and you learn a lot. Coursework in the form of NYRB Style was of great help in deeper understanding of books and were a great writing exercise. Take this course - you will love it!

History of Eastern Europe: conflicts and relationship among the nations
The most important thing I learned is about how to learn history, how to think like a historian
It might be better if weekly reading requirements are limited to 2 books.
The course is very clear and well-organized
The amount of reading might seem intimidating at first, but in a few weeks you will get used to it. You will read a lot, but will also learn a lot. No weaknesses, amazing course.

The readings are extremely interesting. After discussion in class, we can have a better understanding of them.
It is perfect. Prof Snyder is perfect to organize the discussion
Highly recommended. Essential class to get a grasp on East European political history and contemporary political thinking.
Yes, it is a pleasure to take classes with professor Snyder
Absolutely yes. This will be one of the best history courses you will ever take.
Sure! It makes me feel the beauty of history and necessity to learn history.
